data.name: lblVideoConvertTips.Text
data.value: Video convert options only available for host account (super user). Please login with host account if you want to change them.

data.name: plA3Bucket.Help
data.value: If you choose store file via Amazon S3, enter a bucket which will store files.

data.name: lblPermissionCheckDeny.Text
data.value: Video convert permission check failed, please contact your host provider.

data.name: lblPermissionCheckOk.Text
data.value: Video convert permission check ok, congratulation!

data.name: plA3AccessKey.Help
data.value: If you choose store file via Amazon S3, enter access key of your account.

data.name: plVideoConvert_Type.Help
data.value: Select video format which will be converted. H.264 (.mp4) offers better quality but it also consume more cpu resources while converting, its size also big than .flv format.

data.name: plA3SecretKey.Help
data.value: If you choose store file via Amazon S3, enter secret key of your account.

data.name: plGenerateThumb.Help
data.value: If this option is checked, module will automatic generate thubmnail image if necessary. For example, if video image is Cpu.jpg, then module will generate a thunbmail named thumb_Cpu.jpg. It will improve performance greatly while display images in list.

data.name: plThumbnailSize.Help
data.value: Enter thumbnail image size to be generated.

data.name: plFileStorage.Help
data.value: Choose user file storage. For small and medium sites,store files under portal root is enough. However,if you have large amout files to handle, then store them via Amazon Simple Storage Services (Amazon S3) will be a better solution. Check http://aws.amazon.com/s3/ for more detail.

data.name: plPermissionCheck.Help
data.value: To convert videos, web server must give execute permission to DesktopModules\CrossVideo\Exe folder (or its parent folder). Contact your host provider if you don't pass video convert permission check. For more detail, please see "Help - video convert permission" section in CrossVideo_Admin sub module.

data.name: plVideoConvert.Help
data.value: Check this option to convert user upload videos to .flv or h264 (.mp4) format. Note, you must pass the "permission check" to convert videos successfully.

data.name: plVideoConvert_Width.Help
data.value: Choose video width which will be converted. If source video width is small than this value, video will keep its own width after convert. If source video width is bigger than this value,its width will changed after convert. Default value is 480, this is the H.264 video format width of YouTube.com. Choose "use existing video width" option will not change source video width.

data.name: plUseSeoFriendlyUrl.Help
data.value: If this option is checked, module will generate item detail url using item name. For example,if a video name is Cross Video 5.5,then its detail url will be like http://www.youdomainname.com/tabid/453/videoid/232/Cross-Video-5-5.aspx. This will improve seo friendly. We recommend you check this option if your information is written by English. However, for other language like Chinese, it is better to turn this option off.

data.name: A3AuthFailed.Text
data.value: Please check your Amazon A3 access key, secrect key and bucket name,make sure they are correct.

data.name: plProcessExitTime.Help
data.value: Video convert process time limit (millisecond). If convert time exceed value,process will terminate and your video will not continue to convert. Default value is 1800000 (30 minutes),this value will let you convert a video which size bigger than 1G in normal computer. Increase this value if you want to handle very big videos (e.g. dvd files more than 10g). Decrease this value if you don't want user upload big videos.

data.name: MustBetween1To10.Text
data.value: Please input a value between 1 and 10.

data.name: plAllowComment.Help
data.value: Allow visitors to post comment. If this option is not checked, user can't post comments to all videos. If this option is checked, visitors can post comments by default, but each video can disable its own comments if necessary.

data.name: plAllowRating.Help
data.value: Allow visitors to rating video. If this option is not checked, user can't rating to all videos. If this option is checked, visitors can rating by default, but each video can disable its own rating if necessary.

data.name: plAllowRecommend.Help
data.value: Allow visitors to recommend video. If this option is not checked, user can't recommend to all videos. If this option is checked, visitors can recommend by default, but each video can disable its own recommend if necessary.

data.name: plAutoAuthComment.Help
data.value: Auto authorize user comment. Unauthorized comments will not display to normal visitors.

data.name: plCategorySelectCount.Help
data.value: Enter how many video categories a video can belong to. Value must between 1 and 10.

data.name: plCommentRoles.Help
data.value: Select roles which can post comments by default. Note, each video can has its own comment roles.

data.name: plDownloadRoles.Help
data.value: Select roles which can download video attached files by default. Note, each video can has its own attachment download roles.

data.name: plRatingRoles.Help
data.value: Select roles which can ratings by default. Note, each video can has its own rating roles.

data.name: plRecommendRoles.Help
data.value: Select roles which can post comments by default. Note,each video can has its own recommend roles.

data.name: plRequireApproval.Help
data.value: Check this to require videos/audios to be approved before being displayed to visitors.

data.name: plTagSelectCount.Help
data.value: Enter how many tags a video can belong to. Value must between 1 and 10.

data.name: plUserFolderRoot.Help
data.value: Enter folder root which store user upload files. Default value is "CrossUserFile", means that user upload files will store under portals/[portalID]/CrossUserFile folder. You can change them to meet you needs. For example, if you also use our Classified Pro module, you can change it as "CrossClassified" so Cross Video Gallery module will use the same folder root as Classified Pro module.

data.name: plViewRoles.Help
data.value: You can control which roles can view videos/audios by default. Note, each video/audio can has its own view roles.

data.name: plRssItemCounts.Help
data.value: Enter how many items are displayed to RSS feeds.

data.name: plReportEmail.Help
data.value: Enter a email address which will receive abuse report notice. If you leave it as blank, module will not send email notice when visitor submit abuse report.

data.name: plWatchHistoryCount.Help
data.value: Visitor watch history records which will keep in database. Value must between 1-10.

data.name: plAdVideo_Enalbe.Help
data.value: Check to play a ad video before play the actual video.

data.name: plAdVideo_File.Help
data.value: Choose a ad video which will play before the actual video. It is better to provide a .mp4 video and should be a smaller video.

data.name: plAdVideo_Probability.Help
data.value: Enter ad video play probability. Enter 100 will always play ad video. Enter 0 will not play ad video. Enter a value between 0-100 will play ad video randomly. For example,if you enter 60, then it will play ad video using 0.6 probability.

data.name: plEnableDocument.Help
data.value: Check this option to enable user attach documents to his videos/audios.

data.name: plEnableImage.Help
data.value: Check this option to enable user attach images to his videos/audios.

data.name: Tip_AdVideo.Text
data.value:
You can choose a ad video which will play before the actual video. It must be .flv or .mp4 format and should be a small video. You can also control its play probability. Enter 100 will always play ad video. Enter 0 will not play ad video. Enter a value between 0-100 will play ad video randomly. For example, if you enter 60, then it will play ad video using 0.6 probability.

    Note: 1. Choose .mp4 (h264 format) video if you want to support iPhone/iPad/Andriod/Mobile. 2. Ad video can only be played with videos which from local site, it will be ignored when the actual video comes from embed code/YouTube/external sites, or RTMP stream.

data.name: Tip_ReportEmail.Text
data.value: Enter a email address which will receive abuse report notification. If you leave it as blank, module will not send email notification when visitor submit an abuse report.

data.name: Tip_SeoUrl.Text
data.value: If this option is checked, module will generate media detail url using its title. For example, if a video title is Cross Video 5.5, then its detail url will be like http://www.youdomainname.com/tabid/453/videoid/232/Cross-Video-5-5.aspx. This will improve seo friendly. We recommend you check this option if your information is written by English. However, for other language like Chinese, it is better to turn this option off.

data.name: Tip_UserFolderRoot.Text
data.value:
Enter folder root which store user upload files. Default value is "CrossUserFile", means that user upload files will be stored under portals/[portalID]/CrossUserFile/[UserID] folder. For example, if portal id is 0 and a user id is 1, then his files will be stored under portals/0/CrossUserFile/1 folder.
    You can change folder root to meet you needs. For example, if you also use our Classified Pro module, you can change it as "CrossClassified" so Cross Video Gallery module will use the same folder root as Classified Pro module.

data.name: Tip_A3.Text
data.value: To store files on Amazon S3, you must provide below informations: Access key, Secret Key and S3 bucket.

data.name: plManageRoles.Help
data.value: Choose roles which can use "Data Manager" section in CrossVideo_Admin module to manage data. Note, site administrators can manage data by default.

data.name: Tip_EnableRelated.Text
data.value: You can prevent user add related images/documents to video/audio by uncheck below options.

data.name: Tip_ManageRoles.Text
data.value: Choose roles which can access "CrossVideo_Admin sub module - Data Manager" section to manage data. Note, site administrators can manage data by default.

data.name: plSiteMap.Help
data.value: Video sitemap url for your site, you can submit to Google webmaster tools to let Google index your videos more easily.

data.name: secVideoSiteMap.Text
data.value: Submitting your video sitemap to Google

data.name: plDnnSitemap.Help
data.value: Check on this option to integrate with dnn built-in web sitemap

data.name: plDnnSitemap.Text
data.value: Integrate with dnn built-in web sitemap

data.name: Tip_DnnSitemapIntegration.Text
data.value:
As we know, dnn provides a web sitemap which can be submitted to Google webmaster tools to let Google index your site more easily. You can configure your web sitemap url by click dnn standrd menu "Admin - Search engine sitemap". It is a great way to improve your site seo.

  By default, dnn only list your web pages as sitemap urls. However, you can check on below option to let Cross Video Gallery module also includes your video/audio urls in web sitemap urls. It is a must do action if you want to your media be searched more easily.

  We strongly reommend you check on "Integrate with dnn built-in web sitemap" option and submit your web sitemap to Google. Note, if you don't find your media url in your sitemap urls, you need delete Portals/[Portal ID]/Sitemap/sitemap.xml file first to clear existing cache.

  You can follow below steps to submit your web sitemap.

  1. Before you begin, make sure you have the your site added and verified in your Webmaster Tools account.

  2. On the Webmaster Tools home page, click your site.

  3. Under Site configuration, click Sitemaps.

  4. Click "Submit a Sitemap".

  5. In the text box, copy your web sitemap url below and click "Submit Sitemap".

  Note, there is no conflict between your web sitemap and your Google video sitemap. We strongly reommend you submit both of them to Google if possible.

data.name: plJournal_Enabled.Help
data.value: Check to integrate with dnn built-in journal.

data.name: Tip_JournalIntegration.Text
data.value: Check on below options to integrate with dnn built-in journal. When author post a video/audio/comment, module will automatic add a record to his journals.

data.name: AuthFailed_WatermarkImage.Text
data.value: Please provide a valid .gif image as watermark file, or uncheck the "Add Watermark" option.

data.name: plAddWatermark.Help
data.value: Control whether to add watermark to user uploaded photos. The watermark can be a text, or a small image (.gif file).

data.name: plGoogleMapApi.Help
data.value: To integrate Google maps with your videos, you need provide a api key. Cross Video Gallery module already creates a key for you. If you want to use your own, you can sign up a new key at https://code.google.com/apis/console and enter it. Check https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/tutorial for more detail.

data.name: plWatermark.Help
data.value: Select a watermark file (.gif) which will be posted to videos.

data.name: plWatermarkImage.Help
data.value: Choose a .gif file as watermark image.

data.name: plWatermarkPosition.Help
data.value: Watermark Position, can be put on top left/top right/bottom left/bottom right.

data.name: plWatermarkType.Help
data.value: The watermark can be a text, or a small image (.gif file).

data.name: Tip_GenerateThumb.Text
data.value: If this option is checked, module will automatic generate thubmnail image if necessary. For example, if video image is Cpu.jpg, then module will generate a thunbmail named thumb_Cpu.jpg. It will improve performance greatly while display images in list.

data.name: Tip_GoogleMapApi.Text
data.value: To integrate Google maps with your videos, you need provide a api key. Cross Video Gallery module already creates a key for you. If you want to use your own, you can sign up a new key at https://code.google.com/apis/console and enter it. Check https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/tutorial for more details.

data.name: Tip_Watermark.Text
data.value:
Control whether to add watermark to user uploaded photos. The watermark can be a text, or a small image (.gif file). Please note:

    1. Module will try to optimize photo after add watermark. In most cases, this process will keep same photo quality but will reduce photo size.

    2. If you want to generate watermark based gif image, please make sure it is not a animation file. We also recommend you choose a gif image which has transparent background.

    3. See below sample images as a reference.

data.name: plTextFontBgColor.Help
data.value: Watermakr text background color, default is #000000

data.name: plTextFontFamily.Help
data.value: Text font family, default is "Arial". You can change to other font family, but make sure it is a valid font.

data.name: plShowSettingActionButton.Help
data.value: Show setting button in other 11 sub modules, this is useful if you are not familiar with Cross Video Gallery module.

data.name: plShowSettingActionButton.Text
data.value: Show setting button in sub modules

data.name: plShowCopyright.Help
data.value: Select this to add the Cross Video Gallery module copyright credits to the page source.

data.name: plAdVideo_PlayOrder.Help
data.value: Choose the ad video play order
